page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: THIS IS MAINLY HILL FARMING COUNTRY WITH HARDY WELSH MOUNTAIN SHEEP GRAZING ON THE OPEN MOUNTAINS. MOST FARMS BORDER THE MOUNTAIN AND HAVE GRAZING RIGHTS. MECHANISTION HAS GROWN IN THE LAST DECADE AND ALTHOUGH SOME HAY AND CORN ARE STILL GROWN SILAGE IS NOW THE MAIN CROP. CATTLE ARE KEPT IN THE VALLEY, FRIESIANS FOR MILK AND SOME BEEF IN THE HIGHER FIELDS UNTIL MATURE ENOUGH TO SELL FOR FATTENING. MANY FARMERS ARE INVOLVED IN THE TREKKING INDUSTRY,ALTHOUGH THEIR MAIN INCOME IS FROM SHEEP. THE FARMS AVERAGE APPROX. ONE HUNDRED ACRES. THE WIVES KEEP POULTRY FOR THE EGGS AND THE CHRISTMAS TRADE. FARMERS USUALLY SHOP IN THE MARKET TOWN ONCE A WEEK, TRAVELING IN BY LANDROVER BUT STOCKS ARE KEPT TO COPE WITH THE SNOWS OF THE WINTER.
